data.quote: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1956)

data.quote: A wise girl knows her limits, a smart girl knows that she has none.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: It's all make believe isn't it?
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1955)

data.quote: Fame is like caviar, you know - it's good to have caviar but not when you have it every meal.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1954)

data.quote: We should all start to live before we get too old.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1951)

data.quote: If there is only one thing in my life that I am proud of, it's that I've never been kept a woman.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: I am trying to find myself. Sometimes that's not easy.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1952)

data.quote: Millions of people live their entire lives without finding themselves. But it is something I must do.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1954)

data.quote: Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: If I'd observed all the rules, I'd never got anywhere.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: Dreaming about being an actress is more exciting than being one.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1947)

data.quote: I don't want to make money. I just want to be wonderful.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1950)

data.quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: I defy gravity.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1954)

data.quote: One of the best things that ever happened to me is that I'm a woman. That is the way all females should feel.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)

data.quote: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1960)

data.quote: A woman knows by intuition, or instict what is best for herself.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1954)

data.quote: Hollywood is a place where they'll pay you a thousand dollars for a kiss and fifty cents for your soul.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1950)

data.quote: Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1958)

data.quote: We are all of us stars, and we deserve to twinkle
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1954)

data.quote: The truth is, I've never fooled anyone. I've let men sometimes fool themselves.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe (1953)
